question: I need a loan of about R200 000 to extend my home. I have four children who are growing up and need their own space,
answer:
QUESTION

As salaamu Alaikum

Dear Mufti Saheb

I need a loan of about R200 000 to extend my home. I have four children who are growing up and need their own space, I approached an Islamic financial institution. They agreed to lend me the money according to Shariah conditions. However, they say that they will review the loan every year. This means that they will charge a profit on the initial amount of R200 000 and at the end of year one review the profit percentage charged. Is this permissible in terms of Shariah? My understnding is that the amount is fixed over the period and may not very. Please advise.

Also please advise thta if this transaction is not Shariah compliant, have you certified any organisation that can offer me the type of Islamic finance that I require.

 

ANSWER


Share:

Muhtaram Brother

 

Assalamualaikum Warahmatullahi Wabarakatuhu

 

Any excess on a loan is interest and haraam. Any reliable Islamic financial institution will know that. You may request the financial institution to give a written explanation of their offer to you. We will study the proposal and then comment on that. It is possible that you did not understand their proposal in line with Shariah principles of business and dealings.

 

And Allah Knows Best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
